result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Michael Pietrzak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments (TRO/INJCT)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Compete Batterers Intervention program.
Mental health evaluation and follow any treatment recommended.

No contact with victim B.M.H.
No possession of any firearms.
No possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No entry to a premise serving fermented malt beverages or intoxicating liquors.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety with random testing.

Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.  
Defendant to pay the DV surcharge.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Cash bail to apply.
-Court set restitution at zero

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Michael Pietrzak in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Christopher Michael Pietrzak.  Attorney Shelly Grasso in court for State of Wisconsin. CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 10.
Case called withy 22CM0181..
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
*
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
As to Count 1:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 240 days in the House of Correction consecutive to 22CM181.
As to Count 2:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction consecutive to Count 1 and consecutive to 22CM181
consecutive, with credit for  days served. 
Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months.  Probation to run concurrent with 22CM181.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety with random testing
- Mental health evaluation and follow any treatment recommended
- No contact with victim, BMH
- Maintain employment and/or school
- No possession of any firearms
- No possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia
- No entry to a premise serving fermented malt beverages or intoxicating liquors 

Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges
Defendant to pay the DV surcharges

Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail to apply.

Court set restitution at zero.

Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief and State offer letter

Defendant Christopher Michael Pietrzak in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-22-22 at 9:00 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Christopher Michael Pietrzak in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rosenthal was just appointed to the case needs discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned to 7-21-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference, by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Michael Pietrzak not in court, defendant in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Court is in advised that defendant turned himself in to the jail.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  All previous conditions of bail to remain.  Case remains calendared for Pretrial Conference on 6/8/2022 at 8:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Christopher Michael Pietrzak not in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Court reviewed JusticePoint report.  Defendant was released by jail without GPS monitioring or posting alternative bail.  Court will order bench warrant to be issued.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Pretrial Services Status Report 05-16-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 3 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,000.00 cash.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EBH (2/16/2000)

Defendant Christopher Michael Pietrzak in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Christopher Michael Pietrzak in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Michael Pietrzak appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
